Video FAQs Brandfilm Email Marketing BLOG WRITING Our Team Meet Your Marketing Team We’re committed to putting your firm in the Spotlight. In order to make you unforgettable and stand out from your competitors, we pride ourselves on responsive, proactive client service. Meet our rockstar team below, and click here to learn more about our story ! Schedule a Consultation Marc Cerniglia Partner/Cofounder Marc is a founding partner at Spotlight Branding. He is passionate about helping professionals understand the truths and myths about internet marketing, and educating them on how to get the most out of their marketing efforts. He is a proud graduate of UCF and earned his Master’s Degree in Business & Marketing. More Danny Decker Partner/Cofounder Danny Decker is Partner & Cofounder of Spotlight Marketing & Branding. In addition to building his team, he frequently speaks at events and workshops and hosts multiple podcasts on the subject of business and marketing. His books, The Automatic Marketing Machine and Marketing Simplified are available on Amazon. Danny lives in Huntersville, North Carolina, with his wife & their two kids. More Megan Beaver Vice President Megan leads our entire team. Her responsibility is to ensure clients receive outstanding services and content from the Operations team, creating an ongoing relationship and success for clients. A North Carolina local and a graduate of the University of North Carolina at Charlotte, Megan resides in Belmont with her husband and two daughters. In her free time, she enjoys running, tackling home projects, and reading the newest title on her book bucket list. More Jana Eatman Overcash Sales Director Jana is one of the first people you’ll talk to if you’re interested in working with Spotlight Branding. She guides business owners through what we do and how we do it to determine if our services are a good fit for their firm. She graduated from UNC Charlotte, where she pole vaulted and threw javelin for the Charlotte Track and Field team. When she’s not at work, she coaches a local club volleyball team and plays in occasional tournaments herself. Jana also enjoys mountain biking, visiting local breweries, and cooking up a mean steak (medium rare, of course). More Dylan Stebbins Operations Director Dylan is a creative writer who leads with the reader in mind. He's been writing professionally since he was 16; fine-tuning a voice that connects with readers and clients through facts and consideration. When Dylan is not writing he's often reading, hiking, or watching and playing sports. As a graduate of St. Bonaventure University and Western New York native, conversations with him often end with "Go Bills!" More John Hinson Senior Copywriter John is Senior Content Writer where he creates blogs, social media posts, and ad copy for our clients. A graduate of East Carolina University, John spends his free time writing (he’s published 30 books!), playing drums, and hiking to waterfalls. More Stephanie Centeno Copywriter Steph is a passionate storyteller and visual artist. She has been world-building and writing as a form of self-expression since her youth. A voracious reader and keen adventurer, Steph easily settled into a B.A. in History from UNC at Charlotte with an emphasis on ethics, human rights, and film. When she’s not developing compelling copy for clients, you might find her enjoying the outdoors, creating art, and spending time with her husband, two children, and many pets. More Guillermo Rodriguez Lead Ads Coordinator Guillermo Rodriguez serves as a Project Management Assistant, assisting in developing, implementing, and tracking engaging content for campaigns across all digital channels to ensure optimal results for our clients. He lives in Bogotá, Colombia. More Alan Tellez Ads Coordinator Alan Tellez is a Paid Ads Coordinator, specializing in the development, implementation, and optimization of digital advertising campaigns. He works with various platforms and strategies to drive engagement and maximize results. Outside of work, he has a deep appreciation for storytelling through comics, movies, and shows, and enjoys collecting action figures and collectibles. More Mike Pelletier Media Manager Mike has a passion for social media and everything it has to offer. Growing up, he was always interested in creating and showcasing his work. It started with a curiosity in photography, which enabled him to take photos for sporting events, engagement events, and model portfolios. All of these skills came together when he discovered his passion for social media, which led him to work on different social media projects including branding, content creation, and organic growth. When he is not working, he loves spending time with his family and raising his twins to be Rams, Canes, and Yankees fans. More Eddie Dzialo Senior Marketing Strategist After graduating from the University of New Hampshire in 2006, he joined the United States Marine Corps. For the next four years, Eddie served as an infantry officer in the 2nd Light Armored Reconnaissance Battalion and completed tours in Iraq and Afghanistan. Upon leaving, Eddie earned a Master of Fine Arts in writing and published his first short story. When he’s not writing, he sits on Lake Norman while sipping espresso and listening to Dave Matthews. More Nicole Breña Paid Ads Coordinator Nicole, our Paid Marketing Coordinator, manages and optimizes online ad campaigns, combining technical and creative skills. She is a marketing enthusiast who loves romantic comedies on the bookshelf or the big screen. Nicole speaks Spanish, English, and French. She's also a passionate traveler and a lover of alternative, rock, and pop music More Matthew Delaney Account Strategist Matt strategizes ad campaigns that truly connect with audiences. He combines data-driven strategies with creative storytelling to deliver impactful results. A North Carolina native living in Raleigh with his wife, two daughters, two cats, and a dog, Matt spends his free time knitting, gaming, and getting lost in a good fantasy novel. More Fernanda Aguilar Account Strategist Fer was born in Mexico City and has been living in Cancun for many years. She has a degree in International Tourism where she learned her passion for diversity and making people feel special and smile. She is passionate about kindness, learning, curiosity, empathy, traveling, and art. She enjoys music, books, movies, cooking, and training. More Daniela Lemus Account Strategist Daniela is an extrovert communicator based in Puebla, Mexico, with a bachelor’s degree in Communication and 5 years of experience in digital marketing. Throughout her career, she's managed campaigns across different industries, working closely with clients in the US and Europe in roles such as Project Manager, Account Manager, and CSO. She believes empathy is her greatest strength—it allows her to truly connect with people and build long-lasting relationships. Outside of work, you’ll usually find her exercising, binge-watching TV shows, reading, or spending quality time with her pets, family, and friends. To her, time is the most precious thing we have, so she tries to make the most of every moment. More Alejandra Travieso Account Strategist Alejandra is a passionate communicator with a love for designing effective communication strategies and crafting impactful key messages. Hailing from Venezuela, she is a seasoned journalist with a Master's degree in Corporate and Political Communications. Over the past decade, she has dedicated herself to the dynamic world of communications, working with a diverse range of organizations, from NGOs to major corporations. She thrives on the power of words and the art of storytelling to connect, inspire, and make a positive impact in the world. More Andrea Valencia Lead Content Coordinator Andrea is passionate about learning new things and collecting random facts about the world. She’s moved around a lot since she was little so she’s always ready for a challenge and embraces change. Outside of work, her hobbies include all crafty things, trying out new recipes, going to workout classes, and reading. She currently lives in Queretaro with her husband and their two dogs. More Jhoan Rodriguez Content Coordinator Jhoan hails from Veracruz and is an avid sports enthusiast who enjoys both watching and playing a wide variety of sports. On weekends, you can often find him at the baseball stadium, enjoying the game alongside his girlfriend, family, and his dog Sanzón. He graduated from Universidad Cristóbal Colón with a degree in International Business and Markets and has a deep passion for creation and marketing, always striving to see beyond the surface to uncover deeper insights and innovative strategies. More Ishua Nieto Content Coordinator Isu has a bachelor's degree in marketing from Universidad La Salle. She lives in Pachuca, Mexico, but her dream is to be a digital nomad and travel around the world. She loves music, plays the guitar and ukulele, and likes singing. She also enjoys going out with friends, getting to know new places, and living new experiences. More Claudia Castillo Content Coordinator Claudia has a bachelor's degree in Marketing and is currently studying for a master's degree in Digital Marketing. She considers herself a creative person who enjoys exploring new ways to express herself, whether through painting techniques, crochet, or learning a new language. Claudia loves spending quality time with her family and friends, discovering new places, and meeting new people. For her, every new experience is an opportunity to grow, both personally and professionally. More Natalia Canto Content Coordinator Natalia is a creative person with a passion for makeup and a love for trying new things. She graduated from the Colegio de Imagen Pública with a degree in Public Image and specialized in Digital Marketing, combining her strategic knowledge with her flair for creativity. She consistently strives to execute projects innovatively and efficiently, finding original approaches to stand out and make a lasting impact. More Sofia Prestia Administrative Assistant (Office Queen) Originally from New York City, Sofia graduated from Baruch College with a Bachelor's degree in Corporate Communication and Psychology. She is passionate about traveling, positivity, and learning new languages! She speaks English, Spanish, Italian, and is learning French, Japanese, and Portuguese. She also runs the positivi-texts Instagram page as a way to spread sparkle and encourage others. More Free Resource Free Resource Enter your email address below for instant access! Call For Art Call For Art Call For Art “Elegance Unleashed” ~ is a celebration of paws and personality. We’re rolling out the red carpet for pets with panache! Art Spotlight along with the Halifax Humane Society invites you to submit artwork for “Elegance Unleashed,” a juried art show and fundraiser that honors the charisma, style, and soul of our beloved animal companions while raising money to help rescue, shelter and rehome animals in need. A portion of all proceeds is dedicated to this important cause! Learn more A Service for Artists to Shine Art Spotlight is a unique gallery designed to give creatives a space to display their work and grow their artistic presence. Our mission is to preserve, expand, and showcase the vibrant art culture of downtown Ormond Beach by elevating art and fostering collaboration among artists and the community. If you're seeking a platform to expand your artistic horizons and connect with a supportive, dynamic community, Art Spotlight may be the perfect venue for your journey. We provide an exclusive opportunity for artists to showcase their talent, network with other creatives, and contribute to a thriving art scene. We are currently accepting applications from artists who are ready to take the next step in their career. Our selection process is highly curated to ensure a cohesive and diverse group of artists—from emerging creators to established professionals, who are excited to participate in their own success and support the growth of others. Art Spotlight proudly features 2-D and 3-D art, jewelry, and books from local authors. We are always open to unique and innovative ideas, so if you feel your work would enhance our gallery, don’t hesitate to reach out. Applications are juried, and while not all applicants are accepted immediately, every submission is considered for up to one year and opportunities to work together in other ways are available. Our gallery is open Wednesday through Saturday, 11 AM to 5 PM, with private viewings available Sunday through Tuesday by appointment. Are you ready to showcase your talent and join us in taking Ormond Beach’s art scene to the next level? Let’s make it happen! Service Agreement Application Private Art Shows The Art Spotlight front gallery is available for rent for solo and private group shows. Open reception is held in conjunction with the Ormond Art Walk every first Saturday of each month. We are fundraising for our furry friends. Please read the prospectus carefully as this show is a little different. A portion of all sales will benefit Halifax Humane Society. Announcing our "Call to Art" for our September 2025, Ormond Art Walk exhibition at Art Spotlight. Artists working in all mediums can submit up to 2 original artworks for consideration in “Elegance Unleashed” which will be on display at Art Spotlight from September 4 through September 27.  We encourage and welcome submissions from all artists. "Elegance Unleashed" is a celebration of paws and personality. This is a juried show and a fundraiser for the Halifax Humane Society. View Event → Jul 30 to Aug 30 Black and White Photography Wed, Jul 30, 2025 11:00 AM Sat, Aug 30, 2025 5:00 PM Art Spotlight (map) Google Calendar ICS Opening Reception: August 2, 2025, 3 pm to 7 pm Art Spotlight invites photographers to submit work for “Black and White,” a juried exhibition exploring the emotional depth and visual power of monochrome photography. The show will run from August 1–30, 2025, as part of the Ormond Art Walk Theme: “Black and White” celebrates the essence of photography truth revealed through contrast, texture, and light. When color is removed, what remains can be more honest, more powerful, and more profound. We welcome works that embrace this perspective across all photographic styles and subjects. Submission Details: Open to all artists working in photography, up to 2 original black and white artworks may be submitted, work must be suitable for public display and ready to hang, if accepted. All submissions will be juried for quality, originality, and alignment with the theme. View Event → Jun 4 to Jun 28 "Love Out Loud" Wed, Jun 4, 2025 11:00 AM Sat, Jun 28, 2025 5:00 PM Art Spotlight (map) Google Calendar ICS Step into a vibrant celebration of identity, courage, and love, an art exhibit honoring Pride Month. This powerful collection expresses what it means to live authentically and love unapologetically. Through bold color, raw emotion, and diverse mediums, each piece invites you to witness stories of resilience, joy, protest, and pride.
Join us for the opening reception for
“LOVE OUT LOUD”
Saturday, JUNE 7th, from 3pm to 7pm
Our opening receptions are free and open to the public. Join us to celebrate Ormond Beach arts and the community. ***Limited parking behind the gallery. The medical building lot next door will tow, but there is ample free parking across the street at the elementary school. View Event → Oct 7 to Oct 28 "This is Not Art" Sat, Oct 7, 2023 3:00 PM Sat, Oct 28, 2023 5:00 PM Art Spotlight (map) Google Calendar ICS Mark your calendars, art enthusiasts! Local Daytona Beach artist Andrew Balint is set to unveil his captivating collection, "This is Not Art," at the Art Spotlight Gallery in Ormond Beach on Saturday, October 7th, 2023, from 3 to 7 pm. The grand opening ceremony will coincide with the Ormond Beach First Saturday Art Walk, making it a must-attend event for art lovers of all kinds. About Andrew Balint: Andrew Balint, an accomplished artist hailing from Daytona Beach, has a unique perspective on the world of art. His work is a fusion of influences, from street art to abstract expressionism, resulting in a style that defies conventional definitions. Balint's art has garnered recognition for its ability to challenge preconceived notions and stimulate thought. Driven by his passion for creating thought-provoking and visually striking pieces, Andrew Balint has carved a niche for himself in the art world. His works can be described as a blend of bold, vibrant colors and abstract forms that beckon viewers to explore their own interpretations. Each canvas tells a story, often inviting the audience to question their perceptions of reality and art. "This is Not Art" Show Details: Date: Saturday, October 7th, 2023
Time: 3:00 pm to 7:00 pm
Location: Art Spotlight Gallery, 67 W. Granada Blvd, Ormond Beach, FL The opening reception ceremony for "This is Not Art" is free to attend, welcoming art enthusiasts, collectors, and the curious public alike. Guests will have the opportunity to meet the artist, Andrew Balint, and engage in conversations about his creative process and inspirations. Balint's work resonates with those who appreciate art that challenges conventions and pushes boundaries. "This is Not Art" promises to be an unforgettable experience, offering a fresh perspective on the ever-evolving world of contemporary art. Join us on October 7th, 2023, at the Art Spotlight Gallery for an evening of creativity, inspiration, and artistic exploration. Be prepared to have your perceptions challenged, your imagination ignited, and your love for art deepened. For more information about Andrew Balint and his art, please visit his website at artbybalint.com. This class is great for you to enjoy with friends and family members all projects will look totally different in the end. Keep it for yourself or give it as a gift to someone special. Social media image sizes for all networks [September 2025] Skip to content Search Free Trial Log In Start your free trial Blog Open main navigation menu Topics Analytics Video Engagement Experiments Listening Influencer marketing Scheduling Advertising Benchmarks Employee advocacy Content creation Explore all Networks Instagram Facebook TikTok LinkedIn X/Twitter YouTube Explore all Resources Free Tools Glossary Templates Webinars Hootsuite Labs Hootsuite Academy Industries Government Healthcare Education Financial services Nonprofit Real estate Legal Explore all About Hootsuite Pricing Why Hootsuite What’s new Explore all English Español Deutsch Français Strategy Social media image sizes for all networks [September 2025] The most recent image sizes for different social media networks, including Instagram, X, Facebook, LinkedIn, TikTok, Bluesky, and more. Christina Newberry September 4, 2025 10 min read Also available in Español Deutsch Français Table of Contents Quick social media image sizes Instagram image sizes X (f.k.a. Twitter) image sizes Facebook image sizes LinkedIn image sizes Pinterest image sizes Snapchat image sizes YouTube image sizes TikTok image sizes Bluesky image sizes Threads image sizes Social media image sizes seem to change … a lot. Never mind the confusion of new social platforms emerging, with their own content specs and aspect ratios. It doesn’t help that information about official dimensions and image sizes is surprisingly scarce. So what’s the big secret? The lack of official image guidelines is likely directly tied to the frequency of image guideline changes. The platforms don’t want to invest the time and energy to constantly update their image guidelines for end users. Fortunately, dear reader, we have invested that time and energy for you to create this comprehensive (and up-to-date) cheat sheet listing social media image sizes on all important social media platforms! Below are the most recent social media image dimensions, as of September 2025. Quick social media image sizes We go into more detail for every single network below, but this image includes the social media image sizes you probably look up most often. Basic Instagram image sizes Profile photo: 320 x 320 px Landscape: 1080 x 566 px Vertical: 1080 x 1350 px Square: 1080 x 1080 Stories and Reels: 1080 x 1920 Basic Facebook image sizes Profile photo: 196 x 196 px Landscape: 1080 x 566 px Vertical: 1080 x 1359 px Square: 1080 x 1080 px Stories and Reels: 1080 x 1920 px Cover photo: 851 x 315 px Basic X (formerly Twitter) image sizes Profile photo: 400 x 400 px Landscape: 1280 x 720 px Vertical: 720 x 1280 px Square: 720 x 720 px Cover photo: 1500 x 500 px Basic LinkedIn image sizes Profile photo: 400 x 400 px Landscape: 1200 x 627 px Vertical: 720 x 900 px Square: 1200 x 1200 px Cover photo: 1128 x 191 px Basic TikTok image sizes Profile photo: 20 x 20 px Landscape (ad): 1920 x 1080 px Vertical: 1080 x 1920 px Square (ad): 640 x 640 px Stories: 1080 x 1920 px Instagram image sizes Instagram supports horizontally and vertically oriented images well as square images. Well, sort of. You can still use all of these photo orientations in your posts, and that’s how they’ll appear in the Instagram feed. But they will all be displayed with a vertical crop on your Instagram grid. This makes image dimensions a little tricky to get right, especially if you want to control the look of your grid as a cohesive whole. Follow these guidelines to make sure your images end up looking their best. Instagram profile picture size: 320 x 320 pixels Instagram profile photos are displayed at 110 x 100 pixels, but the image files are stored at 320 x 320 pixels, so make sure to upload an image that’s least that big. Even though the dimensions are in a square format, Instagram profile photos are displayed as a circle. Make sure any elements you want to focus on in the photo are centered so they don’t get cropped out. Instagram post sizes: Landscape image: 1080 x 566 pixels (feed) / 1012 x 1350 (grid) Vertical image: 1080 x 1350 pixels (feed) / 1012 x 1350 (grid) Square image: 1080 x 1080 pixels (feed) / 1012 x 1350 (grid) Carousel images: 1080 x 1350 pixels (feed) / 1012 x 1350 (grid) Supported aspect ratios: Anywhere between 1.91:1 and 4:5 (feed) / 3:4 (grid) Recommended image size: Width of 1080 pixels, height between 566 and 1350 pixels Tips: If you want your images to look their best on Instagram, aim to upload an image that is 1080 pixels wide. When you share an Instagram image that’s sized over 1080 pixels, Instagram will size it down to 1080 pixels. If you share a photo that has a resolution lower than 320 pixels, Instagram will size it up to 320 pixels. If your image is between 320 and 1080 pixels wide, Instagram will keep that photo at its original resolution, “ as long as the photo’s aspect ratio is between 1.91:1 and 4:5 (a height between 566 and 1350 pixels with a width of 1080 pixels).” If you upload an image using a different ratio, the platform will automatically crop your photo to fit a supported ratio. Remember that all photos appear in vertical format on your grid. Resource: Learn how to edit Instagram photos like a pro . Instagram Stories image size: 1080 x 1920 pixels This is an aspect ratio of 9:16. The “safe area” is 1080 x 1610 pixels. Make sure to keep important content within that area of the frame. Resource: Take your Instagram Stories to the next level with these free templates . Instagram Reels sizes: 1080 x 1920 pixels (feed) / 1080 x 1440 pixels (grid) The feed aspect ratio is 9:16, while the grid view is 3:4. Instagram ads image sizes: Landscape: 1080 x 566 pixels Vertical: 1080 x 1350 pixels Square: 1440 x 1440 pixels Minimum width: 500 pixels Minimum height: 400 pixels Supported aspect ratios: Anywhere between 1.91:1 and 4:5 Image size for Instagram Stories ads: 1440 x 2560 pixels This is a 9:16 ratio. Instagram recommends leaving roughly “14% (250 pixels) of the top and 20% (340 pixels) of the bottom of the image free from text, logos, or other key creative elements” to prevent them from being covered. Instagram Reels ads size: 1440 x 2560 pixels This is a 9:16 ratio. Instagram recommends leaving roughly “14% of the top, 35% of the bottom, and 6% on each side … free from text, logos, or other key creative elements” to prevent them from being cropped or covered. X (f.k.a. Twitter) image sizes With its new video tab, X is clearly embracing a multimedia experience on the platform. Adding images to your X posts can help you stand out from the crowd. Pssst: This isn’t a video size post, but we will tell you that the recommended aspect ratio for the new X video tab is 9:16 with a minimum resolution of 720 x 1280. X (Twitter) image sizes for profile photos: 400 x 400 (recommended) Maximum file size: 2 MB. X header photo size: 1500 x 500 pixels (recommended) The way header images display changes depending on the monitor and browser being used. Even with the recommended dimensions, 60 pixels can be cropped from the top and bottom. X images sizes for in-stream photos: Landscape image: 1280 x 720 pixels Vertical image: 720 x 1280 pixels Square image: 720 x 720 pixels GIF: 1280 x 1080 pixels Tips Recommended aspect ratio: 16:9 or 1:1 Supported formats: GIF, JPG and PNG Maximum file size: Up to 5MB for photos and GIFs on mobile. Up to 15MB on the web. X image sizes for ads: Image ad with app buttons, website buttons, or polls: 800 x 418 pixels (1.91:1) or 800 x 800 (1:1) pixels. Square images in ads with polls will crop to 1.91:1 in mobile timeline. Image ad with conversation buttons: 800 x 418 pixels (1.91:1). Standalone image ads: 1200 x 1200 pixels (1:1) or 1200 x 628 pixels (1.91:1). Carousel image ads: 800 x 418 pixels (1.91:1) or 800 x 800 (1:1) pixels. All images in the carousel must use the same aspect ratio. Collection ads: 800 x 800 pixels (1:1), max 3 MB. Resource: Find more information here on how to advertise on X (Twitter) . Facebook image sizes Facebook is a tricky platform, because image sizes differ from desktop to mobile, and Facebook users are inclined to use both. (Facebook.com is the world’s third-most popular website .) We’ve got you covered on both fronts here. Facebook profile picture size: 196 x 196 pixels (recommended) Display size desktop: 176 x 176 pixels. Display size smartphone: 196 x 196 pixels. I mage sizes for Facebook cover photo: 851 x 315 pixels (recommended) Display size desktop: 820 x 312 pixels Display size smartphone: 640 x 360 pixels Minimum size: 400 x 150 pixels Ideal file size: Less than 100KB Tips To avoid any compression or distortion, upload a JPG or PNG file. Use the recommended pixel sizes for the fastest load times. Profile pictures and cover photos with logos or text work best when uploaded as a PNG file. Don’t drag to reposition once you’ve uploaded your cover photo. Resource: Get more tips on creating a great Facebook Page . Facebook timeline photo and post sizes: Landscape image: 1080 x 566 pixels (1.91:1) Vertical image: 1080 x 1359 pixels (4:5) Square image: 1080 x 1080 pixels (1:1) Facebook image sizes for Facebook Stories: 1080 x 1920 pixels (recommended ) Facebook Stories take up the full screen of a phone. That’s an aspect ratio of 9:16. Max file size is 30 MB. I mage sizes for Facebook ads: Facebook Feed ad: 1440 x 1440 pixels (1:1) or 1440 x 1800 pixels (4:5). Minimum size 600 x 600 pixels. Maximum file size of 30 MB. Facebook Search: At least 1080 x 1080 pixels. Ratio 1.91:1 to 1:1. Maximum file size of 30 MB. Facebook Marketplace image ads: Minimum 1080 x 1080 pixels (1:1). Maximum file size of 30 MB. Sizes for Facebook Right Column ads (desktop only): At least 1080 x 1080 pixels. Ratio 1:1. Image size for Facebook Stories ads: 1440 x 2560 pixels This is a 9:16 ratio. Maximum file size 30 MB. Facebook recommends leaving roughly “14% (250 pixels) of the top and 20% (340 pixels) of the bottom of the image free from text, logos, or other creative elements” to prevent them from being covered. Facebook Reels ads size: 1440 x 2560 pixels This is a 9:16 ratio. Facebook recommends leaving roughly “14% of the top, 35% of the bottom, and 6% on each side … free from text, logos, or other key creative elements” to prevent them from being cropped or covered. Resource: Here’s more info on how to advertise on Facebook . LinkedIn image sizes Just to keep things spicy, LinkedIn switches some image sizes up between personal profiles and company pages. You’ll find them all here. LinkedIn image sizes for personal p rofiles : Linkedin profile photo: 400 x 400 pixels or larger (recommended). Maximum 7680 x 4320 pixels or 8MB. Cover photo: 1584 x 396 pixels (recommended). Aspect ratio: 4:1. Maximum 8 MB. Tips Cover photos are cropped differently on mobile and desktop. Make sure to view your profile on both kinds of display before finalizing. LinkedIn image sizes for C ompany P ages: Company logo size: 400 x 400 pixels Page cover image size: 1128 x 191 pixels Life tab main image size: 1128 x 376 pixels Life tab custom modules image size: 502 x 282 pixels Life tab company photos image sizes: 900 x 600 pixels Image size for LinkedIn post with URL: 1200 x 627 pixels (recommended) Minimum width: 200 pixels LinkedIn image sizes for ads: Landscape (desktop and mobile): 1200 x 628 pixels (recommended). Minimum 640 x 360 pixels. Maximum 7680 x 4320 pixels. Max file size 5 MB. Square (desktop and mobile): 1200 x 1200 pixels (recommended). Minimum 360 x 360 pixels. Maximum 1200 x 1200 pixels. Max file size 5 MB. Vertical (mobile only): 720 x 900 pixels (recommended). Minimum 360 x 640 pixels. Maximum 2430 x 4320 pixels. Max file size 5 MB. Carousel: 1080 x 1080 pixels. 2 to 10 images. Max file size 10 MB. Pinterest image sizes Pinterest profile image size: 280 x 280 pixels (recommended) Remember that your profile photo will be displayed as a circle. Pinterest image size for profile cover photo: 800 x 450 pixels ( minimum) This is a 16:9 aspect ratio. Pinterest image sizes for Pins: Recommended size: 1000 x 1500 pixels. Recommended aspect ratio: 2:3. Other available ratios are 9:16, 3:4, 4:5, and 1:1. Max file size: 20 MB for web, 1 GB recommended for app. Tips Stay within the safe zone to make sure your content is fully visible on any device: top 270 px, left 65 px, right 195 px, bottom 790 px. Pinterest image sizes for collections Pins: Aspect ratio: 1:1 (recommended) or 2:3 Recommended size: 1000 x 1000 pixels or 1000 x 1500 pixels Max file size: 10MB Tips This format appears as one main image, above 3 to 24 smaller images. The main image’s ratio can differ from the smaller images, but all the smaller images must have the same aspect ratio. Collections appear in feeds on mobile devices. 1:1 format is recommended. If you choose a different aspect ratio, know that these Pins are cropped from the middle. Collections can also be an ad format on Pinterest. Pinterest image sizes for ads: Image and Shopping ads: 1000 x 1500 pixels (recommended). Aspect ratio 2:3 (recommended). Max file size 20 MB. Carousel ads: 1000 x 1500 pixels (2:3) or 1000 x 1000 pixels (1:1) recommended. Up to 5 images. Resource: Get some advice on how to use Pinterest for business . Snapchat image sizes Snapchat profile picture size: 320 x 320 pixels (minimum) Maximum file size is 2 MB. Snapchat banner image size: 375 x 278 pixels (recommended) You can upload an image up to 375 x 569 pixels, but it will crop to 375 x 278 Maximum file size: 2 MB Snapchat ads image size: 1080 x 1920 pixels (at minimum) Aspect ratio: 9:16 File type: JPEG or PNG Maximum file size: 5 MB Tips Don’t put any important content in the top 150 px or bottom 330 px, to make sure it won’t be covered. Resource: Learn how to use Snapchat for business . YouTube image sizes YouTube profile photo size: 800 x 800 pixels (recommended) Tips Make sure the focus of your photo is centered for best results. Maximum file size is 15 MB. Photos will render at 98 x 98 pixels. YouTube banner image size: 2 560 x 1 440 pixels ( recommended ) Aspect ratio: 16:9 Minimum dimensions 2048 x 1152 At the minimum dimensions, the safe area for text and logos to avoid being cut off is 1235 x 338 pixels Maximum file size: 6 MB YouTube video thumbnail size: 1280 x 720 pixels (recommended) Minimum width is 640 pixels Max file size if 2 MB Use a 16:9 aspect ratio YouTube podcast playlist thumbnail size: 1280 x 1280 pixels (recommended) Use a 1:1 aspect ratio Maximum file size: 10 MB Tips You can’t upload a custom thumbnail for Shorts, but you can select which frame from the video to use as the thumbnail. Resource: How to create a YouTube channel . TikTok image sizes TikTok profile photo size: 20 x 20 pixels (minimum size to upload) We recommend uploading a higher quality photo for future-proofing. TikTok video size: 1080 x 1920 ( recommended ) The ideal aspect ratio for vertical TikTok videos is 9:16. You can post videos with other dimensions, but the platform will add black bars to the top and bottom of the videos so they are full-screen. TikTok ads image sizes: Vertical (recommended): 540 x 960 pixels minimum (9:16) Landscape: 960 x 540 pixels minimum (16:9) Square: 640 x 640 pixels minimum (1:1) Carousel: 1200 x 628 pixels or 640 x 640 pixels or 720 x 1280 pixels. 2 to 35 images. Recommended max file size 100 KB. Profile photo for ads: 98 x 98 pixels (1:1). Max file size 50 KB. Resource: How to get more views on TikTok Bluesky image sizes Bluesky profile picture size: 1000 x 1000 pixels Upload a 1:1 profile photo with the most important part of the image in the center. It crops to a circle. Bluesky banner image size: 3000 x 1000 pixels Bluesky renders the banner image differently on desktop and mobile, so it’s a good idea to check different formats to make sure it looks right on each one. Keep the important information in the center. Bluesky image post size: 1000 pixels (height or width) There is no set image size for Bluesky, but the platform stores image files with the longest side at 1000 pixels. Stick with standard image sizes like 1:1, 9:16, 3:4, or 4:5 for best results. Tips Each post can have up to four images. Each image is limited to 1 MB. Resource: How to use Bluesky for business . Threads image sizes Threads profile image size: 640 x 640 pixels Like most other social platforms, the profile image is cropped to a circle. Threads post image size: 1440 x 1920 (recommended) Minimum width: 320 pixels Maximum width: 1440 pixels Acceptable aspect ratio: 0.01:1 to 10:1. Native aspect ratio is 3:4 Maximum file size: 8 MB Tips Carousel posts can include up to 20 images. Resource: How to use Threads effectively in 2025 Why is it important to get social media image sizes right? Social media marketers need to get many things right when creating visual content for social media. You’ve got to make sure the images you use comply with copyright laws . If you don’t have original imagery, you’ve got to find high-quality stock photos . And you’ve got to figure out how to create images that connect with your audience and inspire them to take action. On top of that, you’ve got to get your social media image sizes right. That’s really important because: It avoids pixelation and awkward image stretching to keep your images looking professional. Photos optimized for each social channel’s feed can help increase engagement. Incorrect sizing could cut off some of your brand’s messaging. It can future-proof your content. Using the right social media image sizes now could mean less work for your brand in the future, when networks change up how images display yet again. When building posts in Hootsuite, you never have to worry about getting the image size wrong. You can upload and refine your images using Canva’s editing tools right inside the Hootsuite dashboard. The very first step of the process is selecting a network-optimized size for your image from a drop-down menu. Here’s how it works: Log in to your Hootsuite account and head to Composer . Click on the purple Canva icon in the bottom right corner of the content editor. Select the type of visual you want to create. You can pick a network-optimized size from the drop-down list or start a new custom design. When you make your selection, a login pop-up window will open. Sign in using your Canva credentials or follow the prompts to start a new Canva account. (In case you were wondering — yes, this feature does work with free Canva accounts!) Design your image in the Canva editor. When you’re done editing, click Add to post in the top right corner. The image will automatically be uploaded to the social post you’re building in Composer. Ok About Us It’s our role to keep stages and screens filled with talented performers, so we can continue to watch our favourite characters come to life. Rooted in the tradition of serving the performing arts industry, Spotlight has been at the forefront of connecting performers with the world’s most successful casting professionals across film, television, and theatre since 1927. Today, our cutting-edge SaaS solution empowers performers to showcase their talents by creating dynamic profiles, making them accessible to a vast network of casting directors and independent project creators. It is our mission to facilitate the discovery of new talent and ensure the continued vibrancy of stages and screens worldwide. With our studios in the heart of London’s West End and a global presence through Talent Systems , Spotlight is firmly placed as a cornerstone of the casting industry and the ultimate resource for both performers and casting professionals. The origins of Spotlight In 1927, stage manager Keith Moss conceived the Spotlight Directory to seamlessly connect theatre directors and casting directors with actors. His pioneering publication featured 236 performers, including two exceptional dogs. Rodney Millington, joining as Managing Director, steered Spotlight to become a casting staple by World War II, securing an exemption from paper rationing due to its significance in bolstering morale. After the war, the Seale family took the helm, advancing Spotlight over three generations. They set up central London casting studios and moved the directory online in 1997. The final print edition appeared in 2017, marking a full digital transition. Spotlight today Spotlight’s evolution continued in 2021 by joining the Talent Systems group, alongside Casting Networks , Cast It , Tagmin , Cast It Reach and Staff Me Up , becoming the heart of a global network for talent discovery. Today, Spotlight is proud to be the premier casting home, celebrating the diversity of talent and empowering performers’ careers with our trusted, accessible, and passionate service. Who are Spotlight’s partners? We are honoured to work alongside some fantastic organisations that are making a real difference in the performing arts around the world. Read more about our partners. How to Write Your Artist’s Biography Home About Renee Writing Services for Artists Articles Interviews Resources for Artists RENEE PHILLIPS - MENTOR FOR ARTISTS Helping Artists Achieve Their Fullest Potential You are here: Home / Articles / How to Write Your Artist’s Biography: The Important Basics How to Write Your Artist’s Biography: The Important Basics By Renee Phillips 14 Comments In “How to Write Your Artist’s Biography” I explain what it is, why you need it, suggestions on what to include in it. A compelling and memorable Artist’s Biography reaches out and connects with your reader. It inspires them to bring your art into their lives. Your Artist’s Biography is essential for viewers of your art who want to know more about you. It helps them to understand what makes you unique and tells them about the journey you took to get to where you are now as an artist. On the practical side, your Artist’s Biography provides prospective buyers, gallery owners, curators, grant givers and writers knowledge about you. They want to know about your career accomplishments before they decide to invest in your art and promote you. What Is The Artist’s Biography? The Artist’s Biography is text, written in the third person (she, he) . It serves to provide the reader with a story about you as an artist and learn about your career credentials. It contains much of the same information as a résumé, however, a résumé or CV is written in a listing format and a biography is written in an editorial style. Your Artist’s Biography may contain a brief description of your art work however it is also not the same as an Artist’s Statement , which your write entirely to express creative inspiration, materials, style and artistic vision. On your website limit your Artist’s Biography to approximately 200-250 words. Create different versions of your Artist’s Biography to use for different purposes. Why You Need to write Your Artist’s Biography Photo by DESIGNECOLOGIST on Unsplash You need a well-written artist’s biography to… Promote your art on your website and blog on the “About the Artist” page. Create your profile on your social media platforms. Provide material in your cover letter to a gallery or other art official. Give to a publicity outlet — art editor, feature story editor or radio or TV host. Add to your exhibition press release. Serve as an integral part of a brochure or catalogue. Add to your proposal for a grant, lecture, workshop or panel discussion. Some Ideas ~ What To Include in Your Biography What are the unique attributes of your art? Where have you previously lived and where do you currently live? When, where, and/or why did you begin to take interest in art? Did you study art in school, or were you self-taught? Did you go to college or art school? Where? What did you study? Did you receive any press coverage? What is the title of the magazine/newspaper or blog and the writer’s name? Have you been interviewed on TV or radio? What is the title of the show and person who interviewed you? What exhibitions did you participate in? What is the name of the exhibition location and title of exhibition? Was it a juried or invitational exhibition? What is the name of the juror? Is your art in any important public collections? Which ones? What awards and honors have you earned? Have you served in other art art related capacities,  such as: Serving on the Board of Directors or committee of an arts organization? Avoid These Mistakes I’ve Seen on Artists’ Websites Avoid writing about intimate, personal experiences that are not related to your career or artistic vision. Avoid the use of jargon, colloquialism, and esoteric language that will alienate most potential buyers. Avoid writing long biographies about your trials and tribulations beginning with childhood, grade school art work… Avoid grandiose over-inflated jargon about yourself. Avoid writing excessive quotes and references to famous artists. Remember, if someone is interested in buying your art or showing your art in their gallery they are more interested in your current career credentials, not what you did as a child.
